content: I have brought items using this app and the app works well, very easy to find what you are looking for, they have a huge variety of items and prices are good, free shipping can be slow if you don't want to pay for shipping. But all in all the app is great, I enjoy using it. Update, I have recently notice that some sellers are showing an item with a low price but when you go to puchase it, it is not that item. It is a different item for the lower price. And the item you wanted cost more. Unfair.

It's a really great service! I've gotten decent quality items in the past + it's easy to use! However my issue is the shipping/shipping times. A lot of times I check the shipping on the items I order and it says it's in my city, yet the next day I check it says it hasn't even been sorted in the sorting centers! Aliexpress would be top tier if they fixed this small issue, because quite frankly I'm tired of checking the mail every single morning, just to be disappointed.

I have to remove the app to be able to order from the website (otherwise website takes me back to the app), because the app isn't working for me. Besides there are multiple issues with the app as I can't see the buy 3 items to get free delivery and so many other things that are not working on the app. Not to mention the search menu is not showing what I really am searching for. I wish you would fix the appso I can rate it at 5, because so far I love shopping at AliExpress.

I've been using Aliexpress for a few years now with much success buying good quality products and saving money. Shipping times have always been outstanding. If an issue with a product I ordered ever came up, it was resolved in a timely fashion. Overall, I have no complaints about using the Aliexpress app and can definitely recommend anyone to use it.

I did almost all of my online shopping on my laptop for ages. Over the last few years I've started using phone apps. This one is pretty good. They have made many improvements over time. Really good sales pop up from time to time. There are several games built in for winning discount coins. Overall it's a pretty decent experience. Personally, I keep the notifications off so that I don't get bombarded with annoying ads constantly.

You may or may not receive your order. If you do not, be prepared to jump through months of hoops to try to get a refund. The only dispute process is to call the courier that never received the item and get them to certify non receipt. Very shady in bait and switch pricing, too. An item will list at one price, but it's actually another price, but posted with an entirely different item that is the first price. Shady all around.

I've reviewed this shopping app before and gave it one star. At the time everything was going wrong. I was getting items that didn't last. They'd break under the lightest usage conditions and I could not get a resolution on a credit that was owed to me. I had to go through my bio and lo and behold I got not only the 50% credit they offered me I got a total refund back into my bank account. Since then I've still been shopping on this site and have bought a lot of items. I've had positive results.

Products are excellent. However cancelling orders is difficult and laborious. Substantial discounts did not get applied to the orders as promised by ae and any further orders had to be held up. This is very distressing and will cause problems for the whole months purchases. Tracking is becoming an issue .The product has been delivered and is excellent. The closing process does need to be improved a little bit to make accidents less likely. More like the reviews where each item is checked off.

Love how all of the products are very reasonably priced but you definitely have to read the description on each product because some of the items are misleading and you think your getting one thing when it's something totally different like a comforter set and all you get is the comforter shell sheet. Also it takes forever for some of the products to be delivered while some of them are delivered within a week but I guess it's worth it when your paying way less than what you would anywhere else.

The app works fine. I can find stuff on AliExpress that is unique and I can't get on Temu or Wish. I don't like it that a seller will post a cheap price on an item then charge a lot for shipping or that price is only for one size and it's more for a different size. I think that's dishonest. It's a good app and they have good prices, but sometimes it says it'll be 2 months before it's delivered. So you have to be careful when you order.

You get what you pay for. I've ordered quite a few things from them some good, some not so good. Good luck getting a refund in case anything goes wrong. I've had items missing from orders and issues with items not being as advertised and the amount of hoops you have to jump through and proof you need to provide to get a refund is ridiculous. 95% of the time aliexpress sides with the sellers regardless.

The cart system is very odd, it doesnt show you what you actually have selected first, so you have to scroll to even find it, and it bugs so its not there. The wishlist has a limit, and the cart has a limit, too. So you can never save as many items as you want. Amazon never has this issue, so idk why they chose to do this. The "my picks" cart for the discount items bugs, so you can't click anything, slow loading times, etc. It's good, but boy, is this app bugged all to heck.

Overall the app and the service are very good. The only thing that drives me crazy is the regularly pop-up advertising windows, sometimes without the ability to close without clicking on them (or X is very well hidden); This behavior reminds me of low-grade sites with viral or aggressive advertising, which is disgusting.

Some stuff takes a while to get, but all and all it's a great app. I enjoy getting stuff in the mail and I like to look good too. This app as well as a couple others keep my mailbox full and always something new to try and wear. One thing to watch is that the prices are low but you may have a high shipping price. This usually helps in the long run. You aren't charged tax for shipping. Prices are still lower than local stores and have prices close to shein and temu.

Their cancel account feature is just for show. Tried everything I could, but they just make you jump through hoops only to make the cancel button in the finalization page unavailable. Had to make a whole new email so I wouldn't have to see their ads on my main email. Also if you tried to disable the feature that gives you email ads it gives you the same problem as the account cancelation where they'll straight up not let you.

The application is very deceptive. Platformance designed for people looking to scam you. Be aware of what you're adding to your cart because while an item may look like like a good deal you need to watch for bait and switch items. It might not be what you think. Always check your shipping. There are shops that like to sell items for $100 with $2,000 in shipping. Be aware most electronics you get will either be counterfeit or not work. AliExpress as a whole doesn't care. They enable it all.

Love the low prices but the app is annoying. The advertisements that pop up on my phone even when I'm not using the app are aweful. Makes it seem like my phone has a virus. Also, I find it VERY annoying that you can not access anything from the home page and you have to click through the "choice" items before you can see your cart or account information. Bleh! Sucks!

Overall, the app itself is ok. A little confusing to navigate at first if you don't know where to look for certain things, such as your recent purchases (on bottom row, "account", then near the top "view all". I'm still unsure about how to obtain and redeem coupons, coins, and other bonuses. Refunds and returns are easy enough, although depending on the item, a return isn't always required to obtain a refund. 08/23/2023 unable to update app. No details given, just won't update.

I'm starting to get the pop up ad or screen page glitch every few seconds. It looks exactly like the one that has the orange button, once tap on the screenandgoes to the login screen with different login apps. It's starting to get really annoying when trying to read the descriptions and browsing through the products. Please fix this annoying pop up error glitch. It does make me frustrated and don't feel like getting on AliExpress app.

If you're able to spend the time to research and compare products to one another, you can clearly see the killer deals on things that'd you would normally pay 2-3 times more for on other shopping apps! I've ordered about ~20 items give or take. Items ranging between $0.99-to-$180 and I've never had any bad or questionable experiences, and the things that I ordered more often than not arrived being much high quality than I was expecting by looking at the photos on the site. I'd recommend!!

Tried to return a pair of shoes that were too small and AliExpress refused to provide a return label or refund. I even re-purchased the new size and paid for it in full. But they didn't care to do right by me on the original pair - despite the fact that I spent over $1,000 USD in the last month... Unfortunately, I'll be ordering a lot less from them moving forward. If they want to grow, they should learn from Amazon. Oh, and their app and algorithm needs drastic improvement

Love the products on this app. Buy from here all the time. But the problem is with the site itself. It is so frustrating and annoying. Half the time it freezes up and won't work and the other half of the time it refreshes or goes all way back to home page when you hit go back button. I really wish they would fix this. Cuz when you hit back button you lose your place and it sends you all the way back to home page and refreshes. I hate it. Please fix this.

So far, I've had no bad experience with Ali Express... in fact, I kinda love this app very much! Checking out can be kind of confusing, though. Just make sure you thoroughly read the description and do research before purchasing. Otherwise, you can't help but enjoy browsing. I end up with a cart load every time. **Don't forget to use store coupons when available!**

It is very invasive. Relentless texts and emails, and ads displaying my purchases with no regard for privacy. "Add to cart" can be sketchy. Funny. If you click "Buy it now", THAT works just fine! There are also some weird restrictions on what can ship to the U.S. One product may ship just fine, yet an identical one won't ship to the US. I'm still trying to figure that out. WATCH SHIPPING COSTS VERY CAREFULLY! Sneaky ones lurk out there. $20 for a Walmart camping cart and $480 shipping?!

I shop quite a bit with the AliExpress app. It takes a learning curve to understand how to find specific items, but once you learn, it becomes easy. I know they serve a LOT of languages, and translation from Chinese dilects to English is difficult. I do wish they would invest more resources on this issue, but it is not a show-stopper. Overall. I do applaud them for a really good app and great product selection. I enjoy using the app, and I like doing business with AliExpress.

The worst customer service! Ph numbers don't work, 24/customer service is a joke, and after the transaction, I only received a payment confirmation from PayPal, but none from Aliexpress, not even a tracking update. I'll stick with TEMU. You can call them anytime, refunds are super easy, and most of the time, you can request it to be just put back in the TEMU credit, which takes 3 minutes. Many times, it's not worth it to TEMU to return the item, so you keep or throw it away. EASY!!

I've used it a lot now. Unfortunately with times like they are, it's become more my go to than amazon. If you save the image of a product you saw on amazon and look for it in the search on aliexpress you will probably find it and it will be much cheaper. In the case of a desk chair, it's hundreds cheaper. Also I ordered some hand painted wallpaper from aliexpress for about 1k and it did arrive and it was exactly what they advertised. Honestly most of the products on other apps can be found there

The app gets better over time. It's really easy to order and keeo track of orders within the app. Cons: - Searches should be exact in this day in age. Results are very very inaccurate. If you have the words in the wrong order, your results are completely different. This leads me to believe it's intentional. Either that, or it's poor programming. Please have an accurate search feature!!! - I cannot ask a question to a seller. I have tried in every version and it gives me an error.

I had not dealt with them before, so I really liked the prices! They are for 95% of the time, definitely the best prices, and I've had nothing but extremely great experiences with them! I highly recommend to anyone that if you are looking for a really good quality, performance, or durable item,this is definitely where to go!! Not only are the prices amazing! But they litterly have everything imaginable!! If you haven't shopped here, than you are really missing out!! My recommendation, 100%!!

It is very good, but has some serious downsides. Seems that most sellers publish not their own item photos, and so you can receive something that looks entirely different. Usually you can get refunds, but not always, and that is seriously bad. The color shades are wrong almost always, and it's just frustrating. Another big downside is all the plastic of deliveries. Yet overall a real important app, offering such a huge variety.

I've been using this app since last 10 years, and overall, it's been a decent experience. The prices are competitive, and I've successfully ordered multiple products through it. However, I must mention that the delivery times seem longer compared to other international e-commerce platforms I've used. It would be great if they could enhance delivery speed and tracking reliability.

Not liking the new cart update, it's confusing to see the stuff I just added to my cart down at the bottom as if they were added weeks ago. I can't keep my stuff organized or pick through them without going through the entire list. Please bring back chronological order for the cart. They seem to be organized by who it's shipped by now and that's nice and all but it makes organization confusing. Go back to organizing by seller and when it was added it cart.

Search function has been modified to show dozens of completely unrelated items after the first dozen or so results, making it borderline useless. Finding specific items is now harder when I have to sift through 75% unrelated ads, causing me to close the app and find what I'm looking for on eBay. Users will tolerate a bit of advertising but not at this reduction of function. I like the shops I can find via AliExpress but I'll be taking a break until this is fixed.

the navigation is not good, sometimes is difficult to navigate between pages, and always you lost where you were previously. there are many products that are showing with a lower price but when you open the product page is another item, the item shown in the photo is more expensive. there are some issues with refund, im having an issue with a seller that are trying to use the bugs from the plataform to get money from me, ive contacted twice the chat but they didn't tried to solve.

When to buy some stuff during the last hours of the 11.11 event (sale). It was advertising for every 25$ get 5$ back up to 20$ I bought 100$ worth of items but they only gave me 5$ off. Cancel half the order to rebuy it to get the discount the funds never showed up in my coupons even though it said it would be processed in seconds. Went to check out with the items and it didn't apply any discount. I think the app just swallowed 50$.

Product selection is confusing. I tried for a few months, but found tracking was inaccurate and terrible. A number of items took 2 months to Aust. 2 never arrived. Customer service both from Aliexpress and many sellers is terrible. God help u if u have an issue. One item sent on 24th Dec tracked upto the 28th as still on China. 6 weeks I asked for refund andwer No. They rechecked Tracking and found it was last tracked to Russia and they simply said it was still on its way to Australia.

The last update is worse than the previous version. I used to experience some glitches in the language, as it switches every now and then, & I hoped it'd be solved by the new update. However, it's only gotten worse for now I have to switch it back and forth manually. Yes, I live in an Arabic speaking country, but I want the app's UI language to be English for better UX, because of the bad En>Ar translation. Also, whenever I click on a SUPER deals item it takes me to a webpage! Solve this please!

Some merchants takes forever to send out stuff, when you want to cancel its impossible. Then when there is an issue with the delivery, AliExpress just denies it, you can make a complaint but nothing comes out of it. And its almost impossible to get any refund out of it. So you are welcome for the donation for a useless "support" system.

It's nice and the user interface is quite neat, but I wanna make a suggestion. The coins that we get are only used for discounts obviously. But I was just thinking if you can make the coins earning a challenge and ppl can actually buy stuffs with the coin. This is my first time using AliExpress. This is just a suggestion and it's left to your team to decide. Thanks..........

I have noticed over the last two three years at the AliExpress app has continued to evolve and improve. The app responds quicker and I find it very quick to shop for items on AliExpress, without a doubt the shipping times are not just accurate, but I would say 60-70% of the time my packages will arrive BEFORE the ETA! Quicker many times than Amazon. E-Bay is a disaster because the shipping methods and address mistakes can double their shipping times. AliExpress continues to impress me every day

This app makes it hard to sort items, and has tiny images of the product you select making it hard to actually know until again clicking elsewhere to see large images in your cart. Needs to be a more responsive design. Prices listed are hardly ever your final cost. Annoying. There is no option to only show you costs with shipping added in. When following ads from emails to the ap the prices are always higher. The rating system is set up to pay people with points so it's totally irrelevant.

Watch out for false prices. I placed an order for an item which was a good price. Seller never shipped item. Got my money back. But then notices the price had doubled so they didn't want to sell it to me at the original price. Ordered the same item from someone else and it's happening again. Cheap stuff is fine. Expensive stuff, be careful for gouging.

I have no issue with it. The problem is with vendors claiming to be located in and shipping from the U.S. I have ordered the same item from two different "vendors" claiming to be located in the U.S. and able to expedite my shipment via FedEx. They charge my credit card and never ship the order. They don't say anything or string me along until the shipping deadline expires and the order automatically cancels. Getting a refund is a nightmare. Don't trust them. Vendors are in China and reply late

So far, this app has a dysfunctional interface. To try to get to review an item takes multiple steps and to go back to your profile after requires navigating forward, not backward, which is unusual. It's easier to use on my PC. It gets confusing lumping parts and sets of products together as 1 listing. I thought I was ordering a set, because the price was lower, when in fact they are individual parts. I have not gotten the promotional price of anything yet for being a first time user.Deceiving

The app is easy to use, placing orders is quick and easy. Except for some sellers putting low prices on items that is not directly related to the picture you to click to find out what exactly is being sold. That is time consuming. ( they will show a picture of a nice camera or watch for a very low price and when take your time to confirm the product only to find they're selling a battery for that camera or watch Then the price change when u click again on the product) USER FRIENDLY APP

I personally really like this app and use it all the time when buying stuff. It has low prices and everything, when buying something though I always check the reviews first just to see because sometimes they might come different than the image so it's always best. I have a lot of coins on the app but they rarely do anything, I would recommend this app to friends and family as I like it a lot. Shipping sometimes takes quite a while but it's always worth it

I've had success with all of my purchases. However, the site itself will inundate you with messages with coupons from sellers you never even looked at. The messages aren't from the sellers themselves, but the site auto sending them. It's incredibly annoying and creates issues with the seller if they piss off their customers. As I said, I've had good experiences with the sellers but be prepared for Aliexpress to send you messages all day. The refund option is convoluted and unnecessary

Been using this app for about a month now, and made a couple of purchases as well. Nothing much to complain, but I have a small concern; usually a product having different types are displayed with the image of the highest priced type and the cost of the lowest one. I click on these with excitement only to be disappointed with the actual price!

The customer service sucks! There is a chance your order is wrong, missing or broken. If this happens Aliexpress will always take the sellers side and not give a refund. Their excuse is always that the evidence provided isn't valid. Then they give you the option to send the item you bought back for a refund, but you have to cover the shipping yourself! Sometimes the shipping price is more than the price of the product itself!

Unfortunately the option to have multiple prices for each listing has made this app wildly inaccurate and pretty unusable, you click on something for five euro, when you go into the listing you see that it's not the item you searched for, instead it's some irrelevant washer or something and the item you searched for is in the same listing but it's about sixty euro. Just an update, it's even worse now, no matter what you search for you'll have no results that match just ads.

App is great. Easy to find items. Favouriting makes it much easier to go back to something you're interested in and want to keep an eye on for a better deal WAY too many push notifications. Everything you've looked at, you end up getting push notification for it.

I have been using Aliexpress for a few years now. If everything is ok, then it's good. If you have not received the product, then Aliexpress confirms that the item has been received on your behalf automatically after 84 days. No matter how many times you say that upu have not received the product. The customer service is like a parrot. Keep repeating the same thing again and again. They don’t understand English very well. I am planning to uninstall this app and go fir well known app (A******)

Full of bugs. Forms covered with phone keyboard with no way to tab down. Collect coins but absolutely no way of using them to buy things. Annoying ad on startup which counts down. Floating button gets in the way. Bottom buttons (cart etc) disappear so no way of navigating. So many fake items/reviews, its like being on trust-pilot.

Great app.. I use it all the time, but needs a bug fix.. or else it's intentional?? It's quite invasive: it pops up and takes over Google search results and at other times. I de-installed it once and am not sure it's entirely fixed.. After the Lenovo info harvesting debacle, this makes me nervous!

It is good to order from, if you want something cheap, but don't by something expensive, that's a risk. The app itself is getting corrupt in the way that it's getting buggy, I've experienced it being in inverted colors for a long time now, and there is just too much pop up ads.

Largely easy to find stuff on the app. It might be helpful to add an option to navigate to "picks" from the "cart" icon. If you have active "picks" and have to leave for any reason it can be hard to return and finish.

The app is infested with unwanted popups, coupon scams, and misleading promotions. Most sellers are untrustworthy, the products are junk, and there's no support because the site and sellers are all savvy to the tricks necessary to game the system. If you have any complaints or problems with an order, they just ban you. They only accept credit cards so your only option in case of fraud is a chargeback. There's nothing they sell that is worth the hassle of dealing with deceptive overseas sellers.

This app is a scam. Don't trust it. It is a huge hit or miss with these sellers. Yes, you may recieve some of your items, however, sellers will send you disturbing items that is nothing like what you ordered or you just won't recieve your item at all. Trying to dispute it is useless, don't count on getting your money back. Also, be cautious b/c in order to file a dispute the app wants access to your audio. Now why on earth would they need that???? There are other apps more reliable don't waste.

The App is very helpful, all the products I've bought so far are of good quality and delivery has been earlier than expected apart from 1 item. However, some product sellers need to give more accurate description e.g some school bags don't have any measure; Further more, I would love to be able to buy different varieties/colors for a particular product in a single order.

I loved this app. Used it all the time. Until they decided to block all payment options and demand everything from my drivers license to bank statements. Absolutely not. Shady AF and screams scam central. No other shopping app has ever asked for anything like that. There's not even a notification that they blocked anything until you go to pay. Customer service gave a half-hearted non explanation for why they did it. Will definitely delete by the end of the year if I'm still blocked.

SCAMMERS. Things are cheap, but note that you will get ZERO support if the seller scams you. Use eBay instead, similar pricing and much safer / better support. I opened a dispute because the AliExpress seller sent me completely the wrong item. I included detailed photos of the item, packaging (both sides), all tracking numbers, details on what I should have been sent. Everything! Literally every piece of evidence that exists. Result: no refund. Don't use this scam site.

Make shopping easier, good work. I love this app because it makes shopping much easier and has lots of promotions, freeshiping, and most importantly, protects your investments. It allows you to download pictures of the items you are interested in along with dimensions and sizes of products.

I believe this company has come a long way since their beginning and they work very hard to make all of it's shoppers satisfied and happy. I use both this app and their website on my PC, as both platforms offer benefits. If AE can shorten their delivery times, they will become larger than most online retailers. Thanks always, AliExpress!

Thank goodness for Seller taking his time to send all necessary updates, files and instructions to finish install. Refund service on Ali Express seems to be non existent. Myself and friends of mine always get denied returns and Refund on expensive items. Use at your own risk. Basically regardless of item price you are stuck with what you get.

I love AliExpress. Yes you get what you pay for so use your head. If it seems to good to be true it is. There are true bargains to be found and stuff that goes straight in the bin. I have never had any bother with the sellers who go out of thier way to keep customers happy. Of all the sketchy online shopping including eBay I recommend it to my family and friends no worries. Just use your brain. still a great app just be conscious of travel and world issues. Still use it once a fortnight.

Loved the app! 9.5/10 . Had SO many great products at bargain prices, even without the sale. Only thing, is that the tax isn't added on the shown price! And any issues/error are always rectified with easy return/refund depending on issue, but again they are so minimal, its really not an issue for me!

Very happy with the app. Saves you money, if you don't mind waiting for it. Edit: reducing to two stars because when sending messages through the app, it is impossible to find a modified picture, like the one that marks what is wrong with the product or part of it, and the message center is impossible to find.

I have probably bought about 50 items through this app. In the main I've been pretty happy. However, if you do have an issue you're knackered. AliExpress will basically refer you back to the seller who will give you the run around and then refer you back to AliExpress who say your buyer protection has expired. Really poor customer service. AliExpress need to realise a bad experience will stop people using them.

Sellers are allowed to scam buyers now. They give you false tracking info and also lose your item(s) in US customs and then they won't refund you. They also have AI customer service so you can't deal with/chat with anyone who will resolve your problem. They also do everything to avoid refunding your money. I went right to my credit card company to start a chargeback on the purchase since Aliexpress won't do it. Beware.

Amazing app full of wonderful sellers. If you pay attention to picking the right items from the right shop... you'll be fine. Just make sure you read the reviews properly before buying! So far I haven't had a single problem and I always receive top quality products at amazing prices.

There are crooks acting as legitimate sellers. Zero decent customer experience. We are just a #. You pay for an item and they send you something different (ordered shorts and received a hdmi cable instead!). Raised a case with Aliexpress and it was closed with 'no proof'!! Do yourself a favour if you're going to buy through this app, video record the parcel and open it. Or good luck raising a dispute when you get screwed - just a matter of time. There are plenty more app options out there now.

I ordered a wireless charger, a type c cable, and a car charger from Aliexpress and I was pleasantly surprised by the fast delivery. It took less than a week to arrive in KSA, which is much faster than I expected. The wireless charger has a very good built quality and material, and it works well with my phone. The type c cable is also ok, but I haven't tested the car charger yet because I ordered it as a spare one. Overall, I am satisfied with my purchase and I think the products are worth the

I went to purchase a item that cost less then $20 and you wanted to charge me almost $50 for shipping that's a bit crazy don't you think. I'm deleting this all. Anyone would be crazy to pay more for shipping then the item is worth. And the more you get the higher the shipping gets.

Beware: 11.11 scams, the prices are much higher, dont waste you money. Warning! High battery usage from this app, more that demanding game. I suspect that they mine crypto or move a lot of data. About the app, hard to find my liked items and the sellers aren't very ethical about the items. No easy way to find how to reach support. The coin games are pointless, the discounted items sometimes cost more than non discounted.

It's really good app however you need to know veracity of the products and the store, they are really cheap there's good stuff in there but you need to pick carefully to not buy clone or weak things, almost thing are from the factory himself, so quality may be very random, there's a lot of various products like exactly parts of electronics like other stuff, the downside of the app, it's like I said they come from the other side of the world, so maybe they are gonna take a while to come

I have ordered from AliExpress numerous times now. Some times u get great stuff, some times u get some cheap BS that looks nothing like what's advertised. But the worst part is, at least 3 times my order has never been sent and I've had no choice but to cancel it. If u r gonna let seller's on ur platform, then u r responsible for them. They shouldn't be allowed to offer a sale price, and then never send the order so u have to go back and pay full price. Or so they think u will anyway.

Most of the items purchased break within a short period, and it's incredibly difficult $$$ to get a replacement. Only had negative experiences when shopping on this platform. Will use other vendors, avoid at all costs.

Overall, the app does what it is intended to do. My only criticism is the marketing "games" for "coins", and I suspect that the developers of the app usually make those "free" mobile games most of the time, and have missed the brief. The games are the source of any nuisance, whether a pop up or a notification, and since it's a marketing/catalogue app, there should be the option to turn off the "games" and their respective notifications, because it's a catalogue, not a "free" game.

This app has it's good side and it has its bad sides but I've received everything that I've ordered from this app. Some items were bad and some items were really good. Some items take forever to receive and some items came fast it all depends on the seller and make sure they have good reviews. 8 out of 10 times the ones that have good reviews are the ones that you can count on receiving and getting a good product.

Generally the app is quite good. One functionality could be added: if the seller writes an enquiry it is visible within the app notifications but not in the buyers emails on his primaty email account, which is a bit inconvenient and may cause delays in providing a reply. Best regards.

Very good app. Very good prices and shipping times very. However some of the items are not as described and are pure junk. So if you're prepared to lose a few dollars on a simple gamble go for it. Most items are pretty good.

Low cost and fast shipping to UK. Problem is, the packaging is terrible and probably 65% of what I have bought has arrived damaged. Returns are easy, but who can be bothered with that? They are legit, but I honestly wouldn't recommend, I've given up with them.

I have been shopping with Ali Express for a while now, and all in all, it has been a good experience. The app is very easy to use. Deliveries are usually pretty quick. The longest you will have to wait is around 1 month. It really depends on how quickly the seller sends off the items that you ordered.
